pullRequest.body:
We use the newly added positivity results for holomorphic functions to show that the L-function associated to a sequence `a : ℕ → ℂ` such that `a 1 > 0` and `a n` is nonnegative real for all `n` takes positive real values on the real axis.

From [EulerProducts](https://github.com/MichaelStollBayreuth/EulerProducts); this is needed to prove the non-vanishing at `s = 1` of Dirichlet L-functions of nontrivial quadratic characters. 

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:

- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

`+ iteratedDeriv_LSeries_alternating`

LGTM now, thanks!

maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11531582442/job/32102443720)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11531582442/job/32102443681)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
This should be moved upstream; putting it at line 1000 of `Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Pow.Real` seems to work.
move to `LSeries/Basic`?
It might be more natural to require instead `abscissaOfAbsConv a ≤ x` here (since we assume equality on `{s | x < s.re}`)

```suggestion
  rw [term_def]
  split_ifs with hn
  exacts [le_rfl, mul_nonneg h (inv_natCast_cpow_ofReal_pos hn x).le]
```

```suggestion
simpa only [term_of_ne_zero hn] using mul_pos h <| inv_natCast_cpow_ofReal_pos hn x
```

```suggestion
    | zero => simpa only [Function.iterate_zero, id_eq] using hn k
```

```suggestion
lemma positive_of_differentiable_of_eqOn {a : ℕ → ℂ} (ha₀ : 0 ≤ a) (ha₁ : 0 < a 1) {f : ℂ → ℂ}
```
(consistent with order of arguments)

```suggestion
  have hxy' : abscissaOfAbsConv a < max x y + 1 := hx.trans_lt <| mod_cast hxy
```
(needed if non-strict inequality assumed in `hx`)

```suggestion
    simpa only [hf' hys, ofReal_add, ofReal_one] using positive ha₀ ha₁ hxy'
```
Seems overkill when one function is constant, maybe `continuous_re.isOpen_preimage _ isOpen_Ioi`?

Two chained `converts` seems convoluted, it can be golfed using `simpa`:
```
    simpa only [hf'.iteratedDeriv_of_isOpen hs n hys, ofReal_add, ofReal_one] using
      iteratedDeriv_alternating ha₀ hxy' n
```
(any changes to the `LSeries` lemma above can be propagated to here too)
